OCD.name: Container Instance
OCD.description: Allows for the creation of containers.

AD.name: Enabled
AD.description: Enables this container

AD.name: Image name
AD.description: The image the container will be created with. The value will need to be expressed in the form registryURL/imagename in case of a custom registry. Please fill the following registry credentials in case of pulling from a custom or authenticated Docker hub registry.

AD.name: Image tag
AD.description: Describes which image version that should be pulled from the container registry.

AD.name: Trust anchor
AD.description: Trust anchor used to verify the container image signature.|TextArea

AD.name: Verify in transparency log
AD.description: Sets the transparency log verification, to be used when a container image signature has been uploaded to the transparency log.

AD.name: Authentication Registry URL
AD.description: Url for docker registry. Required only for authenticated registries

AD.name: Authentication Username
AD.description: Username for container registry. Required only for authenticated registries

AD.name: Password
AD.description: Password for container registry. Required only for authenticated registries

AD.name: Image Download Retries
AD.description: The number of retries to pull the container image. Set to 0 for unlimited retries

AD.name: Image Download Retry Interval
AD.description: The interval (in milliseconds) between retries to pull the container image

AD.name: Image Download Timeout
AD.description: Image download timeout. Value specified in seconds

AD.name: Internal Ports
AD.description: A comma-separated list of ports. If no protocol is specified tcp will be used. Note, the number of internal ports must be equal to the number of external ports. A port internet protocol can also be specified with a colon and text after the port number. Example: 80, 443:udp, 8080:tcp.

AD.name: External Ports
AD.description: A comma separated list of ports. Note, the number of external ports must be equal to the number of internal ports. Example: 8080, 443.

AD.name: Privileged Mode
AD.description: Give the container privileged access. (Warning: use this option at your own risk as privileged containers can be dangerous)

AD.name: Environment Variables
AD.description: Additional container enviroment variables. Example: example_var_1=123, example_var_2=123.

AD.name: Entrypoint Override
AD.description: Comma separated list which is used to override the command used to start a container. Example: ./test.sh,-v,-d,--human-readable

AD.name: Memory
AD.description: The maximum amount of memory the container can use in bytes. Set it as a positive integer, optionally followed by a suffix of b, k, m, g, to indicate bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, or gigabytes. The minimum allowed value is platform dependent (i.e. 6m). If left empty, the memory assigned to the container will be set to a default value by the native container orchestrator.

AD.name: CPUs
AD.description: Specify how many CPUs a container can use. Decimal values are allowed, so if set to 1.5, the container will use at most one and a half cpu resource.

AD.name: GPUs
AD.description: Specify how many Nvidia GPUs a container can use. Allowed values are 'all' or an integer number. If there's no Nvidia GPU installed, leave the field empty.

AD.name: Volume Mount
AD.description: The path on the container at which you would like to mount a file or folder. Example: /path/on/host1:/path/on/container1, /path/on/host2:/path/on/container2.

AD.name: Peripheral Device
AD.description: Used to pass physical devices to a container. Example: /dev/gpiomem, /dev/ttyUSB0. (Generally Requires privileged mode to be enabled)

AD.name: Runtime
AD.description: Specifies the fully qualified name of an alternate OCI-compatible runtime, which is used to run commands specified by the 'run' instruction. Example: 'nvidia' corresponds to '--runtime=nvidia'.

AD.name: Networking Mode
AD.description: Used to specify what networking mode the container will use. Possible Drivers: bridge, none, container:{container id}, host. Note: This field is case-sensitive.

AD.name: Logger Type
AD.description: Used to specify what logging driver the container will use. By default, containers will log to a JSON-FILE on the gateway.

AD.name: Logger Parameters
AD.description: Used to pass logger parameters to a container's logging driver. Example: max-size=10m, max-file=2.

AD.name: Restart Container On Failure
AD.description: Automatically restart the container when it has failed.

AD.name: Container Image Enforcement Digest
AD.description: Digest of the container image allowed to run on the device if the Container Enforcement Monitor is enabled. If not given, it will be computed by the Container Signature Verification service.
